sub_title: Independent Architect/Health Infrastructure specialist at IDD studio
summary:
Practical, open-minded, constructive, team player, developer and designer

Senior architect with a specific interest in health infrastructure and broad experience covering all areas of the construction field; Urban Design, Architectural Plans, Construction Supervision and Project Management.

Extensive experience in the design and construction of hospitals in developing countries in Africa, Asia and Central  America with a focus on high infection risk areas, like operating theaters, delivery units, emergency rooms, laboratories and HIV/TB clinics and hospitals.
Co-author of the MSF handbook “Tuberculosis health facility design handbook” 

Broad experience in the humanitarian field in the coordination of medical and logistic activities including strategical project development, team coordination, daily activity coordination  and security management.

Development of temporal hospital structures and designs for emergency field hospitals, like general referral, Ebola, Cholera hospitals or Surgical units. 
Expertise on disaster and climate change risk adaptation and mitigation measures and resilient hospital infrastructure. 

My broad orientation and experience in different fields of expertise will best be shown to advantage in an innovative environment with teams that deal with complex issues and where there is a need for a high level of responsibility, independence and flexibility. My ultimate goal is to develop ‘interesting, elegant and creative solutions’ that are broadly carried by all stakeholders, but also move people in one or another way

profile_positions.location: Son en Breugel, North Brabant, Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Independent Architect / Health Infrastructure Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Dec 2019-Sept 2020: Consultancy for the Asian Development Bank - contribution to the development of a capital investment plan in the Philippines for the period 2020-2040 that aims to achieve qualitative and resilient health infrastructure along the introduction of Universal Health Care
Oct 2019: Consultancy for Rebel Group International - location analysis for planned dialysis centers in Uzbekistan
profile_positions.title: Independent Architect/Health Infrastructure Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Mar-Apr 2018: Consultancy for MSF-Switzerland: Development and implementation of temporal hospital structures for the extension of the MSF-OCG hospital in Agok, South Sudan
May 2018: Consultancy for Mott MacDonald: Implementation of temporal hospital structures for the extension of the hospitals in Axum and Addis Zemen, Ethiopia
profile_positions.title: Independent Architect/Health Infrastructure Specialist (ZZP)

profile_positions.description: Development and production of temporal hospital structures based on modular tent systems
profile_positions.title: Architect/Health Infrastructure Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Provision of support to all MSF-OCA projects (approx. 75 projects in 25 countries) with architectural and technical building solutions, environmental infection control measures, construction process, management, budgeting and planning. A wide range of shelter and building solutions are used n the humanitarian context that varies from tents, semi-temporal, semi-permanent to permanent structures while the support is provided from the headquarters in Amsterdam as well as through regular field visits during the all the phases of an emergency response and in established projects. 
In order to be better prepared, part of the work consists of the development of better standards, systems, tools and equipment that are used to support the humanitarian activities.

Innovation:
Development of standard plans for a surgical unit, field hospital, cholera treatment centre and ebola management centre 
Development of standard operation theatres
Ventilation system of field operating theatres
Development of a ballistic protection sheet for high security level areas
Participation in European Union sponsored innovation project: S(P)EEDKITS (http://www.speedkits.eu, 3 years)
Development of an upgradable semi-permanent shelter system based on PVC tents

Publications:
Co-author of Tuberculosis Health Facility Design Handbook, 2017
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Consultant, Health Infrastructure Specialist, Architect

profile_positions.description:
Main projects that have successfully been finalized: 
2010: 	New container Emergency Obstetrics Hospital CROU in Port au Prince, Haiti 
2011: 	New hospital in Lulimba, DRC, South Kivu
2011:	Rehabilitation and renovation of the BSL-3 laboratory in Mbabane, Swaziland
2011:	New HIV/TB clinic in Epworth Harare, Zimbabwe 
2012:	New BSL-3 laboratory in Nukus, Uzbekistan
2012:	Master plan and extension of Hospital in Baraka, DRC South-Kivu
2012:	Renovation of MDR-TB building in Harare, Zimbabwe 
2012:	New HIV/TB clinic in Yangon, Myanmar
2012:	Master plan and extension of Amtiman Hospital, Chad
2013:	Master plans for field hospitals in Leer, Lankien, Nasir in South Sudan 
2013:	New ICU and Maternity unit in Amtiman Hospital, Chad
2013:	Master plan and extension of hospital in Mweso, DRC North-Kivu
2013: 	Design of a new laboratory and extension of Epworth HIV/TB clinic in Harare, Zimbabwe
2014:	Maternity and Nicu extension of hospital Lashkargah, Afghanistan
2014:	Upgrade of the existing MoH tuberculosis laboratory in Grozny
2014:	Design of an Ebola clinic in Magburaka, Sierra Leone
2015: 	Upgrade of the neonatal department of the CRUO Hospital in Port au Prince, Haiti
2015: 	New ICU in Bossangoa Hospital, Central African Republic (CAR)
2015:	New BSL-3 laboratory in Grozny, Russia 
2016:	Extension and rehabilitation of Psychiatric hospital in Harare, Zimbabwe
2016:	Extension and renovation of Emergency and ICU departments in Sulaymaniyah, Irak
2016:	Master plan and upgrade of the field hospital in Kule Gambella region Ethiopia
2016:	Design of a TB compound in Danod, Somalia region Ethiopia
2016:	Proposal for the rehabilitation of a BSL-3 laboratory in Dniepro, Ukraine 
2017:	Upgrade of the field hospital in Bentiu, South Sudan
2017: 	Extension and rehabilitation of the operating theatre in Bambari hospital, CAR.
2017:	Proposal for a new multi-drugs resistant TB hospital in Kandahar, Afghanistan
2017:	Upgrade and rehabilitation of the BSL-3 laboratory in Mbabane, Swaziland
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Consultant, Health Infrastructure Specialist, Architect

profile_positions.description:
General coordination and management of the Urabá project (5 expats, 40 national staff)

Specific tasks: Reorientation of the project and definition of project proposal and annual plan, security and incident management, closing Saiza intervention (4,5 years presence), establishing Riosucio and Bajo Atrato intervention (just initiated), evaluate and initiate Urabá-Antioquia intervention, assistance to local emergencies and extensive contribution to national security plans and country policy.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of general logistics and implementation of logistic systems in Harare, Epworth and Gweru projects.

Specific tasks: Organization of logistic management and implementation of standard MSF logistic systems and supply chain, implementation of pharmacy management system, review and upgrade of communication systems, support to construction works in Epworth and Gweru.
profile_positions.title: Logistic Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
General coordination and management of the Malanje project (5 expats, 80 national staff)

Specific tasks: Closing the project (after 14 years of presence), support to the closing of Xa-Muteba, assistance to cholera intervention, definition of end of mission strategy (handover of activities to MoH), definition and implementation of advocacy campaign, handover all MSF stocks and structures, human resource management around closing.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
General coordination and management of the Urabá, Sucre/Bolívar and Norte de Santander projects

Specific tasks: Security and incident management, facilitating and support to Project Proposal process of all three projects, finalizing AP 2007 and 12M 2006, facilitating team for Country Policy evaluation, upgrade and review of communication system, advocacy campaign ‘Living in Fear’, HIV advocacy strategy and Mental health advocacy strategy
profile_positions.title: Head of Mission

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of general logistics and implementation of logistic systems in the Urabá, Sucre/Bolívar and Norte de Santander projects

Specific tasks: Development and implementation of pharmacy guideline, update of security guidelines, development of emergency response plans, construction of new clinic/house in Riosucio, adaptation of clinic in Sincelejo.
profile_positions.title: Logistic Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Assistance and contribution to projects, development of a system for time and budget management, upgrade, maintenance and management of computer system, network and applications (24 computers)
profile_positions.title: Project planning and Computer network manager

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of general logistics and implementation of logistic systems in the Peshawar and Quetta projects at the time of the earthquake intervention

Specific tasks: Revision of security management, review and implementation of pharmacy management of both projects, implementation of a latrine project and improvement of the water system in Mohammad Kheil refugee camp, adaptation of the Alisai Hospital, total review and improvement of ICT equipment
profile_positions.title: Logistic Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of general logistics and implementation of logistic systems in the Costa Atlantica, Sucre/Bolívar and Norte de Santander projects

Specific tasks: Construction of new clinic in Sincelejo, construction works on house and health post in Saiza, development of water and sanitation program, implementation of pharmacy system, improvement of international importing system
profile_positions.title: Logistic Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of general logistics for the basic and mental health care project in rural Cordoba, Sucre and Bolivar, mobile brigades (2 teams) to rural high security areas

Specific tasks: Project development (program, mobile brigade system), security management, emergency interventions, construction of storage building, rehabilitation of the office, development of water filter system, stock management, cold chain, installation of computer network
profile_positions.title: Project logistician

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of general logistics in a Malaria program (two mobile teams, one clinic), STI program (two clinics), PHC program (three sites) and HE activities in Maungdaw and a Malaria program (one mobile team), STI program and HE activities in Sittwe

Specific tasks: Extension of the office, construction of a clinic/house, rehabilitation of two STI clinics and adjustments on expatriate houses, technical management and maintenance of vehicles (5 cars, 4 boats, trawlergy) and equipment, stock management on two project sites for all programs, cold chain, maintenance of computers and communication equipment
profile_positions.title: Project logistician
